Dr. Hongda Chen is a Professor at Peking Union Medical College Hospital (PUMCH) and the chief of the Center for Prevention and Early Intervention of the National Infrastructure for Translational Medicine (PUMCH branch). He received his Bachelor of Preventive Medicine and Master of Epidemiology and Biostatistics from Peking University (2005‚Äì2012), and his PhD in Cancer Epidemiology from the German Cancer Research Center (DKFZ) and Heidelberg University (2013‚Äì2016), followed by postdoctoral research at DKFZ.

His research centers on cancer epidemiology, with a particular focus on cancer prevention and early detection. Dr. Chen has published more than 80 peer-reviewed papers in leading journals such as Science Bulletin, Gut, Clinical Cancer Research, Clinical Gastroenterology and Hepatology, and American Journal of Gastroenterology, with an H-index of 37. He has led over 10 major research projects, including grants from the National Natural Science Foundation of China and national key R&D programs. In 2025, he was recognized by Stanford University and Elsevier as one of the world‚Äôs top 2% most-cited scientists.

He serves on several national academic committees related to cancer screening and prevention, and as reviewer for leading journals including BMJ, Nature Medicine, JAMA Internal Medicine, and Lancet Gastroenterology & Hepatology.
